definition: lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: All of that is possible, but not a slam dunk by any stretch.
sentences.chinese: 這一切都是可能的，但不會是一錘定音。

sentences.english: It is modest and audacious, all at once.
sentences.chinese: 這是適度而大膽的行動，一錘定音。

sentences.english: Whatever decision you make now is set in stone.
sentences.chinese: 您現在做的任何決定都是一錘定音的。

sentences.english: And when you get an answer, you can be sure that it is the final answer.
sentences.chinese: 而您得到的回覆一定就是一錘定音的答案。

sentences.english: But we have yet to find the magic bullet.
sentences.chinese: 但我們仍然有待找到那顆一錘定音的魔彈。

sentences.english: And their decision is final. Except for court.
sentences.chinese: 他們的決定除法院外，是一錘定音的。

sentences.english: "Is old too gentleman one pummel bench a sound, " comes to a decision so.
sentences.chinese: 老太君一錘定音，“就這麼決定了。

definition: to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
administrative authority/executive power
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
to occupy by force
to be determined to win (idiom)
title/official appellation
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
Saudi Arabia (Tw), abbr. for 沙烏地阿拉伯王國|沙乌地阿拉伯王国
political relations
(Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
inexperienced/junior (employee etc)
law and order/rules and discipline
